Jinnō Shōtōki, pp. 220-221. ==Events of the Ken'ei era== * 1206 (Ken'ei 1, 2nd month): Shogun Sanetomo's standing at court was raised to the 2nd rank of the 4th class.Titsingh, p. 227. * 16 April 1206 (Ken'ei 1, 7th day of the 3rd month): The emperor planned to pay a visit to the Kujō Yoshitsune, but in the night before this visit, an unknown assassin killed Yoshitsune. After the killing, Konoe Iezane was made sesshō (regent) and Fujiwara no Tadatsune was made the Minister of the Left (sadaijin).Titsingh, pp. 228-229; Brown, pp. 339-341. * 1206 (Ken'ei 1, 12th month): Konoe Iezane stopped being sesshō; and instead, he became Chancellor (kampaku).Titsingh, p. 229. * 1207 (Ken'ei 1): Hōnen and his followers are exiledJodo Shu, "About Honen Shonin" ; retrieved 2012-4-29. ==Related pages== * Kamakura period ==References== ==Other websites== * National Diet Library, "The Japanese Calendar" -- historical overview plus illustrative images from library's collection Ken'ei 1st 2nd 1206 1207 Preceded by: Genkyū Era or nengō: Ken'ei Succeeded by: Jōgen Category:Japanese eras Category:1200s establishments in Japan Category:1200s disestablishments in Japan Category:1206 establishments
